00005 """New implementation of Visual Studio project generation."""
00006 
00007 import os
00008 import random
00009 
00010 import gyp.common
00011 
00012 # hashlib is supplied as of Python 2.5 as the replacement interface for md5
00013 # and other secure hashes.  In 2.6, md5 is deprecated.  Import hashlib if
00014 # available, avoiding a deprecation warning under 2.6.  Import md5 otherwise,
00015 # preserving 2.4 compatibility.
00016 try:
00017   import hashlib
00018   _new_md5 = hashlib.md5
00019 except ImportError:
00020   import md5
00021   _new_md5 = md5.new
00022 
00023 
00024 # Initialize random number generator
00025 random.seed()
00026 
00027 # GUIDs for project types
00028 ENTRY_TYPE_GUIDS = {
00029     'project': '{8BC9CEB8-8B4A-11D0-8D11-00A0C91BC942}',
00030     'folder': '{2150E333-8FDC-42A3-9474-1A3956D46DE8}',
00031 }
00032 
00033 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00034 # Helper functions
00035 
00036 
00037 def MakeGuid(name, seed='msvs_new'):
00038   """Returns a GUID for the specified target name.
00039 
00040   Args:
00041     name: Target name.
00042     seed: Seed for MD5 hash.
00043   Returns:
00044     A GUID-line string calculated from the name and seed.
00045 
00046   This generates something which looks like a GUID, but depends only on the
00047   name and seed.  This means the same name/seed will always generate the same
00048   GUID, so that projects and solutions which refer to each other can explicitly
00049   determine the GUID to refer to explicitly.  It also means that the GUID will
00050   not change when the project for a target is rebuilt.
00051   """
00052   # Calculate a MD5 signature for the seed and name.
00053   d = _new_md5(str(seed) + str(name)).hexdigest().upper()
00054   # Convert most of the signature to GUID form (discard the rest)
00055   guid = ('{' + d[:8] + '-' + d[8:12] + '-' + d[12:16] + '-' + d[16:20]
00056           + '-' + d[20:32] + '}')
00057   return guid
00058 
00059 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060 
00061 
00062 class MSVSSolutionEntry(object):
00063   def __cmp__(self, other):
00064     # Sort by name then guid (so things are in order on vs2008).
00065     return cmp((self.name, self.get_guid()), (other.name, other.get_guid()))
00066 
00067 
00068 class MSVSFolder(MSVSSolutionEntry):
00069   """Folder in a Visual Studio project or solution."""
00070 
00071   def __init__(self, path, name = None, entries = None,
00072                guid = None, items = None):
00073     """Initializes the folder.
00074 
00075     Args:
00076       path: Full path to the folder.
00077       name: Name of the folder.
00078       entries: List of folder entries to nest inside this folder.  May contain
00079           Folder or Project objects.  May be None, if the folder is empty.
00080       guid: GUID to use for folder, if not None.
00081       items: List of solution items to include in the folder project.  May be
00082           None, if the folder does not directly contain items.
00083     """
00084     if name:
00085       self.name = name
00086     else:
00087       # Use last layer.
00088       self.name = os.path.basename(path)
00089 
00090     self.path = path
00091     self.guid = guid
00092 
00093     # Copy passed lists (or set to empty lists)
00094     self.entries = sorted(list(entries or []))
00095     self.items = list(items or [])
00096 
00097     self.entry_type_guid = ENTRY_TYPE_GUIDS['folder']
00098 
00099   def get_guid(self):
00100     if self.guid is None:
00101       # Use consistent guids for folders (so things don't regenerate).
00102       self.guid = MakeGuid(self.path, seed='msvs_folder')
00103     return self.guid
00104

00106 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107 
00108 
00109 class MSVSProject(MSVSSolutionEntry):
00110   """Visual Studio project."""
00111 
00112   def __init__(self, path, name = None, dependencies = None, guid = None,
00113                spec = None, build_file = None, config_platform_overrides = None,
00114                fixpath_prefix = None):
00115     """Initializes the project.
00116 
00117     Args:
00118       path: Absolute path to the project file.
00119       name: Name of project.  If None, the name will be the same as the base
00120           name of the project file.
00121       dependencies: List of other Project objects this project is dependent
00122           upon, if not None.
00123       guid: GUID to use for project, if not None.
00124       spec: Dictionary specifying how to build this project.
00125       build_file: Filename of the .gyp file that the vcproj file comes from.
00126       config_platform_overrides: optional dict of configuration platforms to
00127           used in place of the default for this target.
00128       fixpath_prefix: the path used to adjust the behavior of _fixpath
00129     """
00130     self.path = path
00131     self.guid = guid
00132     self.spec = spec
00133     self.build_file = build_file
00134     # Use project filename if name not specified
00135     self.name = name or os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(path))[0]
00136 
00137     # Copy passed lists (or set to empty lists)
00138     self.dependencies = list(dependencies or [])
00139 
00140     self.entry_type_guid = ENTRY_TYPE_GUIDS['project']
00141 
00142     if config_platform_overrides:
00143       self.config_platform_overrides = config_platform_overrides
00144     else:
00145       self.config_platform_overrides = {}
00146     self.fixpath_prefix = fixpath_prefix
00147     self.msbuild_toolset = None
00148 
00149   def set_dependencies(self, dependencies):
00150     self.dependencies = list(dependencies or [])
00151 
00152   def get_guid(self):
00153     if self.guid is None:
00154       # Set GUID from path
00155       # TODO(rspangler): This is fragile.
00156       # 1. We can't just use the project filename sans path, since there could
00157       #    be multiple projects with the same base name (for example,
00158       #    foo/unittest.vcproj and bar/unittest.vcproj).
00159       # 2. The path needs to be relative to $SOURCE_ROOT, so that the project
00160       #    GUID is the same whether it's included from base/base.sln or
00161       #    foo/bar/baz/baz.sln.
00162       # 3. The GUID needs to be the same each time this builder is invoked, so
00163       #    that we don't need to rebuild the solution when the project changes.
00164       # 4. We should be able to handle pre-built project files by reading the
00165       #    GUID from the files.
00166       self.guid = MakeGuid(self.name)
00167     return self.guid
00168 
00169   def set_msbuild_toolset(self, msbuild_toolset):
00170     self.msbuild_toolset = msbuild_toolset
00171 
00172 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00173 
00174 
00175 class MSVSSolution(object):
00176   """Visual Studio solution."""
00177 
00178   def __init__(self, path, version, entries=None, variants=None,
00179                websiteProperties=True):
00180     """Initializes the solution.
00181 
00182     Args:
00183       path: Path to solution file.
00184       version: Format version to emit.
00185       entries: List of entries in solution.  May contain Folder or Project
00186           objects.  May be None, if the folder is empty.
00187       variants: List of build variant strings.  If none, a default list will
00188           be used.
00189       websiteProperties: Flag to decide if the website properties section
00190           is generated.
00191     """
00192     self.path = path
00193     self.websiteProperties = websiteProperties
00194     self.version = version
00195 
00196     # Copy passed lists (or set to empty lists)
00197     self.entries = list(entries or [])
00198 
00199     if variants:
00200       # Copy passed list
00201       self.variants = variants[:]
00202     else:
00203       # Use default
00204       self.variants = ['Debug|Win32', 'Release|Win32']
00205     # TODO(rspangler): Need to be able to handle a mapping of solution config
00206     # to project config.  Should we be able to handle variants being a dict,
00207     # or add a separate variant_map variable?  If it's a dict, we can't
00208     # guarantee the order of variants since dict keys aren't ordered.
00209 
00210 
00211     # TODO(rspangler): Automatically write to disk for now; should delay until
00212     # node-evaluation time.
00213     self.Write()
00214 
00215 
00216   def Write(self, writer=gyp.common.WriteOnDiff):
00217     """Writes the solution file to disk.
00218 
00219     Raises:
00220       IndexError: An entry appears multiple times.
00221     """
00222     # Walk the entry tree and collect all the folders and projects.
00223     all_entries = set()
00224     entries_to_check = self.entries[:]
00225     while entries_to_check:
00226       e = entries_to_check.pop(0)
00227 
00228       # If this entry has been visited, nothing to do.
00229       if e in all_entries:
00230         continue
00231 
00232       all_entries.add(e)
00233 
00234       # If this is a folder, check its entries too.
00235       if isinstance(e, MSVSFolder):
00236         entries_to_check += e.entries
00237 
00238     all_entries = sorted(all_entries)
00239 
00240     # Open file and print header
00241     f = writer(self.path)
00242     f.write('Microsoft Visual Studio Solution File, '
00243             'Format Version %s\r\n' % self.version.SolutionVersion())
00244     f.write('# %s\r\n' % self.version.Description())
00245 
00246     # Project entries
00247     sln_root = os.path.split(self.path)[0]
00248     for e in all_entries:
00249       relative_path = gyp.common.RelativePath(e.path, sln_root)
00250       # msbuild does not accept an empty folder_name.
00251       # use '.' in case relative_path is empty.
00252       folder_name = relative_path.replace('/', '\\') or '.'
00253       f.write('Project("%s") = "%s", "%s", "%s"\r\n' % (
00254           e.entry_type_guid,          # Entry type GUID
00255           e.name,                     # Folder name
00256           folder_name,                # Folder name (again)
00257           e.get_guid(),               # Entry GUID
00258       ))
00259 
00260       # TODO(rspangler): Need a way to configure this stuff
00261       if self.websiteProperties:
00262         f.write('\tProjectSection(WebsiteProperties) = preProject\r\n'
00263                 '\t\tDebug.AspNetCompiler.Debug = "True"\r\n'
00264                 '\t\tRelease.AspNetCompiler.Debug = "False"\r\n'
00265                 '\tEndProjectSection\r\n')
00266 
00267       if isinstance(e, MSVSFolder):
00268         if e.items:
00269           f.write('\tProjectSection(SolutionItems) = preProject\r\n')
00270           for i in e.items:
00271             f.write('\t\t%s = %s\r\n' % (i, i))
00272           f.write('\tEndProjectSection\r\n')
00273 
00274       if isinstance(e, MSVSProject):
00275         if e.dependencies:
00276           f.write('\tProjectSection(ProjectDependencies) = postProject\r\n')
00277           for d in e.dependencies:
00278             f.write('\t\t%s = %s\r\n' % (d.get_guid(), d.get_guid()))
00279           f.write('\tEndProjectSection\r\n')
00280 
00281       f.write('EndProject\r\n')
00282 
00283     # Global section
00284     f.write('Global\r\n')
00285 
00286     # Configurations (variants)
00287     f.write('\tGlobalSection(SolutionConfigurationPlatforms) = preSolution\r\n')
00288     for v in self.variants:
00289       f.write('\t\t%s = %s\r\n' % (v, v))
00290     f.write('\tEndGlobalSection\r\n')
00291 
00292     # Sort config guids for easier diffing of solution changes.
00293     config_guids = []
00294     config_guids_overrides = {}
00295     for e in all_entries:
00296       if isinstance(e, MSVSProject):
00297         config_guids.append(e.get_guid())
00298         config_guids_overrides[e.get_guid()] = e.config_platform_overrides
00299     config_guids.sort()
00300 
00301     f.write('\tGlobalSection(ProjectConfigurationPlatforms) = postSolution\r\n')
00302     for g in config_guids:
00303       for v in self.variants:
00304         nv = config_guids_overrides[g].get(v, v)
00305         # Pick which project configuration to build for this solution
00306         # configuration.
00307         f.write('\t\t%s.%s.ActiveCfg = %s\r\n' % (
00308             g,              # Project GUID
00309             v,              # Solution build configuration
00310             nv,             # Project build config for that solution config
00311         ))
00312 
00313         # Enable project in this solution configuration.
00314         f.write('\t\t%s.%s.Build.0 = %s\r\n' % (
00315             g,              # Project GUID
00316             v,              # Solution build configuration
00317             nv,             # Project build config for that solution config
00318         ))
00319     f.write('\tEndGlobalSection\r\n')
00320 
00321     # TODO(rspangler): Should be able to configure this stuff too (though I've
00322     # never seen this be any different)
00323     f.write('\tGlobalSection(SolutionProperties) = preSolution\r\n')
00324     f.write('\t\tHideSolutionNode = FALSE\r\n')
00325     f.write('\tEndGlobalSection\r\n')
00326 
00327     # Folder mappings
00328     # Omit this section if there are no folders
00329     if any([e.entries for e in all_entries if isinstance(e, MSVSFolder)]):
00330       f.write('\tGlobalSection(NestedProjects) = preSolution\r\n')
00331       for e in all_entries:
00332         if not isinstance(e, MSVSFolder):
00333           continue        # Does not apply to projects, only folders
00334         for subentry in e.entries:
00335           f.write('\t\t%s = %s\r\n' % (subentry.get_guid(), e.get_guid()))
00336       f.write('\tEndGlobalSection\r\n')
00337 
00338     f.write('EndGlobal\r\n')
00339 
00340     f.close()
